pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:0.5: 14. The training rule on six years
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.2: At that time monks were having blankets made every year.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.3: They kept on begging and asking,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.7: “How can the Sakyan ascetics have blankets made every year, begging and asking,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.9: We only make blankets for ourselves every five or six years, even though our children defecate and urinate on them and they are eaten by rats.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.12: The monks heard the complaints of those people,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.13: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.14: “How can those monks act like this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.16: After rebuking those monks in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.17: “Is it true, monks, that some monks are acting like this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.21: “How can those foolish men have blankets made every year, begging and asking,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.23: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.24: And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.25.1: ‘If a monk has had a new blanket made, he should keep it for six years.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.26: Whether that blanket has been given away or not, if he has another new blanket made in less than six years, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:1.27: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.1: At one time a certain monk at Kosambī was sick.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.2: His relatives sent him a message:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.7: “The Buddha has laid down a training rule
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.8: that a monk who has had a new blanket made must keep it for six years.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.9: Because I’m sick, I’m not able to take my blanket when I travel.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.10: And because I’m not comfortable without it,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.13: Soon afterwards he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.14: “Monks, I allow you to give a blanket-permission to a sick monk.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.15: And it should be given like this.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.16: After approaching the Sangha, the sick monk should put his upper robe over one shoulder and pay respect at the feet of the senior monks. He should then squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.18: I’m not able to take my blanket when I travel.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.19: I ask the Sangha for a blanket-permission.’
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.20: And he should ask a second
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.22: A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.23: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.24: The monk so-and-so is sick. He is not able to take his blanket when he travels.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.25: He is asking the Sangha for a blanket-permission.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.26: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should give a blanket-permission to monk so-and-so.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.28: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.29: The monk so-and-so is sick. He is not able to take his blanket when he travels.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.30: He is asking the Sangha for a blanket-permission.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.31: The Sangha gives a blanket-permission to monk so-and-so.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.32: Any monk who approves of giving a blanket-permission to monk so-and-so should remain silent.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.33: Any monk who does not approve should speak up.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.34: The Sangha has given a blanket-permission to monk so-and-so.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.35: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.37: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.38.1: ‘If a monk has had a new blanket made, he should keep it for six years.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:2.39: Whether that blanket has been given away or not, if he has another new blanket made in less than six years, except if the monks have agreed, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.2: newly made is what is meant.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.4: it is made by strewing, not by weaving.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.6: has made or has had made.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.7: He should keep it for six years:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.8: he should keep it for a minimum of six years.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.11: That blanket has been given away:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.12: it has been given to others.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.14: it has not been given to anyone.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.15: except if the monks have agreed:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.16: If he makes another new blanket, or has one made, unless the monks have agreed, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.17: When he gets the blanket, it becomes subject to relinquishment.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.18: The blanket should be relinquished to a sangha, a group, or an individual.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.19: “And, monks, it should be relinquished like this.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.20: (To be expanded as in [Relinquishment 1](pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.5--3.2.29), with appropriate substitutions.)
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.21: ‘Venerables, this blanket which I had made after less than six years without the agreement of the monks is to be relinquished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.22: I relinquish it to the Sangha.’ …
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.25: ‘I give this blanket back to you.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.26.1: If he finishes what he began himself, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.27: If he gets others to finish what he began himself, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.28: If he finishes himself what was begun by others, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.29: If he gets others to finish what was begun by others, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.31: if he makes one after six years;
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.32: if he makes one after more than six years;
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.33: if he makes one, or has one made, for the sake of another;
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.34: if he obtains what was made by another and then uses it;
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.35: if he makes a canopy, a floor cover, a cloth screen, a mattress, or a pillow;
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.36: if he has the permission of the monks;
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.38: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np14:3.39: The fourth rule, the training rule on six years, is finished.
